channel.title: Axoloti says exeption: soft watchdog
channel.description:
Axoloti says exeption: soft watchdog
any ideas what this means? I'm getting disconnects while running midi to and from the usb device.

item.title: Axoloti says exeption: soft watchdog
item.dc:creator: @chaosmoon
item.description:
@chaosmoon wrote:

it just happened again:

Ping: WaitSync Timeout, disconnecting now

Read full topic

item.title: Axoloti says exeption: soft watchdog
item.dc:creator: @chaosmoon
item.description:
@chaosmoon wrote:

i've done that and so far, so good.

What puzzles me is that with "all ins" selected and the channel set to "auto" it should only let midi through if the channel is armed right?

Read full topic

item.title: Axoloti says exeption: soft watchdog
item.dc:creator: @Illuminate
item.description:
@Illuminate wrote:

chaosmoon:

It seems to be related to Ableton Live. I'm sending midi notes from Live on midi channel 2 and Axoloti is sending back notes on channel 1.I've had it happen in various patches doing this.

make sure the midi track in ableton which is set to send on channel 2 to axoloti, has the midi set to no input (or set it specifically to what you will be using for its input (like a midi keyboard) not all ins and all channels which is default) otherwise you will get a midi loop which will cause crashes.

Read full topic

item.title: Axoloti says exeption: soft watchdog
item.dc:creator: @johannes johannes
item.description:
@johannes wrote:

Could it be a midi loop? Perhaps Ableton is re-transmitting the incoming midi to channel 2?
Could you isolate the two parts to identify the root cause: receiving midi from ableton, and sending midi to Ableton?

Read full topic

item.title: Axoloti says exeption: soft watchdog
item.dc:creator: @chaosmoon
item.description:
@chaosmoon wrote:

1.0.6

It seems to be related to Ableton Live. I'm sending midi notes from Live on midi channel 2 and Axoloti is sending back notes on channel 1.
I've had it happen in various patches doing this.

Read full topic

item.title: Axoloti says exeption: soft watchdog
item.dc:creator: @johannes johannes
item.description:
@johannes wrote:

The watchdog is a hardware subsystem on the microcontroller that resets the microcontroller if it does not get "fed" in time (periodically). The audio handling routine feeds the watchdog.
Are you using the latest release or compiled firmware from git? Is it dependent on the complexity of the patch running?

Read full topic
